head.supplied: ¶ [Dr Mueller has been writing to me this morning with a complaint that as the cool nights are approaching their numbers [prostitutes] are increasing for the amusement of the soldiers.]...

div.p: Bundle 1, unit 7, VPRS 1199 inward correspondence, VA 724 Victoria Police, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only. On 3 October 1866,Lieut.-Col. W. C. Trevor,14th Regiment,wrote to the Chief Commissioner of Police, F. Standish: 'Sometime ago I mentioned to you that the Botanical Reserve was infested with a gang of prostitutes: the British soldier being the attraction: you kindly sent a Policeman whom I saw walking them off.' He then alludedas aboveto the letterhe had receivedfrom M and asked: 'Would you kindly allow a Policeman to take a look round some evening'. Standish sent Trevor's letter on 3 Octoberto Superintendent Lyttletonwith the instruction, 'Let a Const. be told off'; a further annotationfrom Sub-Inspector Ryallindicates that this had been done.
[Dr Mueller has been writing to me this morning with a complaint that as the cool nights are approaching their numbers [prostitutes] are increasing for the amusement of the soldiers.]
